snippet: To admirers, Anthony D. Weiner in Congress was a tireless worker on many issues; to detractors, he was ineffectual, impatient and publicity-hungry.
abstract: Anthony D Weiner, during his time in Congress, appeared to his admirers as tireless worker on many issues, but detractors say he was ineffectual, impatient and publicity-hungry; while Weiner earned admiration for his devotion to constituents, those who worked alongside him say he had single-minded focus on generating attention so he could run for mayor of New York (Series: In the Running).

byline.original: By DAVID M. HALBFINGER and DAVID W. CHEN

lead_paragraph: To admirers, Anthony D. Weiner in Congress was a tireless worker on many issues; to detractors, he was ineffectual, impatient and publicity-hungry.

headline.main: Weiner’s Record in House: Intensity, Publicity and Limited Results
headline.print_headline: Weiner’s Record in House: Intensity, Publicity and Limited Results
